label: Data source(s) disclosed
description: Indicates that this visualization has one or more disclosed data sources

label: Open data
description: Indicates that the data is open and available

label: Dataset downloadable
description: Indicates that there is a link to the data source(s)

label: Data source citation
description: Indicates that the data is described in a written article (e.g., scientific paper, public report) with a citation.

label: Original data available
description: Indicates the availability of primary data sources prior to processing, such as handwritten documents, images, text.

label: Trusted data source
description: Indicates that a visualization author trusts the source for their data indicated

label: Dynamic data
description: Indicates that data in this visualization can be regularly updating

label: Data up-to-date
description: Indicates data is up-to-date

label: Data limited
description: Indicates that the author wants to disclose limitations with their

label: Analysis limited
description: Indicates that the author wants to disclose limitations with their analysis, without wanting to be too precise at this level.

label: Missing data
description: Indicates some parts of the data is missing

label: Contains modeled data
description: Indicates that a computational model has been used to create the entire or parts of the data set

label: Contains predictions
description: Indicates that the entire or parts of the data are future prediction implying (unqualified) uncertainty

label: May contain bias
description: Description missing.

label: Contain noise
description: Indicates that data contains noise

label: Heterogeneous data
description: Indicates that a lot of different sources used in a chart (but not as a composite)

label: Self-Reported data
description: Indicates: The data was reported by subjects (e.g., survey responses, self-assessments).

label: Derived data
description: Indicates that the data was inferred or model-generated

label: Manual data collection
description: Indicates that humans gathered or collected the data by hand

label: Hardware based collection
description: Indicates that the data comes from physicial devices (e.g sensors, lab appartus)

label: API-Based collection
description: Indicates that the data was obtained via an API (e.g Twitter data for sentiment analysis)

label: Data Collection Period Specified
description: Indicates the period in which a dataset has been collected

label: Attributed data creator(s)
description: Indicates a named person responsible for data collection

label: Adapted elsewhere
description: Indicates that the data or visualization has been picked up and reused by someone else.

label: Contains Multiple Data Sources
description: Indicates that this visualization includes data from more than one source, i.e., implying aggregation and merging operations.

label: Single Data Source
description: Indicates that a visualization contains a single data source only

label: Missing Values Processed
description: Indicates that the author handled missing data via imputation, deletion, or other strategies.

label: Outliers Removed
description: Indicated that the author handled outliers in data set

label: Binning applied
description: Indicates that continuous data were converted into bins/buckets

label: Data normalized
description: Indicates that certain normalization/scaling techniques were applied. E.g. min-max normalization, z-score standardization)

label: Tokenization applied
description: Indicates that text was tokenized. e.g for NLP tasks

label: Part-of-Speech Tagging Applied
description: Indicates that Part of Speech Tagging was applied. (e.g in NLP pipelines)

label: Features Extracted
description: Indicates that features were extracted (e.g., SIFT for images, word embeddings for text, etc.)

label: Stemming / Lemmatization applied
description: Indicates that Stemming/Lemmatization was applied on text

label: Stopwords Removed
description: Indicates that stop words (e.g and, or, in) have been removed during preprocessing

label: Analysis Tools Available
description: Indicates that data analysis was performed using an acknowledged and available tool

label: Automatically Labeled Data
description: Indicates part of the entire data set comes from automatic labeling

label: Random sampling applied
description: Indicates that data points were selected on a purely random or probabilistic method

label: Stratified Sampling Applied
description: Indicates that subgroups (strata) pre-identified, and samples drawn proportionally from each subgroup

label: Systematic sampling applied
description: Indicates that the data points were chosen at a regular interval

label: Clustered sampling applied
description: Indicates that a subgroup/cluster is used as the sampling unit

label: Alternative Units
description: Provides a reference to better comprehend used scales/units in the chart.

label: Unfamiliar units
description: Indicates that this visualization contains units likely unfamilar to the intended audience.

label: 95% CI error bars
description: Highlights the correct interpretation of error bars used in a visualization

label: Temporal offset
description: Indicates that latest time stamp used in a chart is behind the actual time,

label: Time Window Filter applied
description: Indicates that data was included or excluded based on a specific time range

label: Condition Based Filter applied
description: Indicates that data was included or excluded based on certain conditions or status indicators

label: Geographic Filter applied
description: Indicates that the dataset is filtered by location-based rules

label: Demographic Filter applied
description: Indicates that data was included or excluded based on demographic attributes (e.g., age, gender, income, etc.).

label: Data manually Excluded
description: Indicates that data has been manually removed for a given reason, e.g., ...

label: Sorting and Filtering methods
description: Indicates that viewers can individualize their chart reading experience by applying sorting and filtering techniques

label: Aggregated data
description: Indicates that data in the visualization has been aggregated, implying some sort of aggregation method.

label: Simpson's Paradox
description: Indicates that aggregated or combined data may hide or reverse underlying trends

label: False Cause Fallacy
description: Reminds the reader of a visualization that a correlation in the visualization may not or knowingly is not a cause.

label: Major Finding
description: Indicates that this visualization contains a major finding for the analysis or communication

label: Adjusted Baseline Calculations
description: Indicates that the chart uses a shifted reference point rather than "zero". E.g - per capita rates - moving average ..

label: Possible Visual Artifacts
description: Indicates that a visualization algorithm may introduce visual patterns that are not really in the data.

label: Rounding Errors
description: Indicates that data in the visualization may contain rounding errors

label: Don't draw False Conclusions
description: Warns the reader that a seemingly obvious visual pattern may lead to false conclusions.

label: Shows Only Top X Elements
description: Indicates that only X slected elements are shown

label: For General Album
description: Indicates that this chart was created for the General Album

label: For Domain Experts
description: Indicates that this chart was created for domain experts

label: For Policy Makers
description: Indicates that this chart was created for policy makers

label: Chart licensed under Album Domain
description: Indicates which licensing information applies for this chart

label: Chart available under <X> License
description: Indicates which licensing information applies for this chart

label: Data licensed under Album Domain
description: Indicates which licensing information applies for this dataset

label: Attributed visualization creator(s)
description: Indicates a named person responsible for chart creation

label: Content Warning
description: Indicates that the chart is about a sensitive topic

label: Contains specific terminology
description: Highlights specific domain terminology used in the chart, can potentially include explanations (e.g., kp/co2 is the measure of ...)

label: Terminology explanations available
description: Description missing.

label: Background Reading Available
description: Indicates that more background reading is available

label: Mouse Over
description: Indicates that more details will be provided on hover

label: Zoom
description: Indicates that the map is zoomable

label: Interactive pre-filtering
description: Indicates that the visualized data is pre-filtered but can be manually adjusted

label: Chart is device responsive
description: Indicates that the chart is not device responsive

label: Projection not area preserving
description: Indicates that the used map projection is not area preserving

label: Points don't match exact locations
description: Indicates that the placement of the points on the map does not reflect on their exact location (e.g., zipcode).

label: Uncertainty shown
description: Highlights how uncertainty is visualized (e.g., error bar, confidence band) and reasons how to correctly read it

label: Uncertainty not shown
description: Reasons why the uncertainty in the dataset is not visualized. E.g., to keep things simple

label: Dual-Axis encoding
description: Indicates the visualization uses two different axes.

label: Truncated axis
description: Justifies why the axis in the chart is truncated

label: Inconsistent axis intervals
description: Axis intervals are inconsistent, potentially misleading.

label: Inverted axis
description: Indicates an axis is inverted, potentially misleading interpretation.

label: Y-axes across visualization don't align
description: Indicates Y-axes have different scales across visualizations.

label: Non-linear scales
description: Justifies non-linear scales

label: Size distortion
description: TODO: Check if there is a non-deceptive reason

label: Exaggerated small values
description: Indicates that very small data points are over exaggerated to not miss them

label: Some elements too small to be shown
description: Indicates that in the chart some data points/marks are too small that they are not shown

label: Contains overlapping visual marks
description: Visual marks may overlap.

label: Colorblind-Friendly Colors
description: Indicates that colorblind friendly colors are used in the chart

label: Optimized for printing
description: Indicates that printing has been optimized

label: Bubble size encoding
description: Indicates that bubbles in the visualization encode a data variable (e.g., size, area)

label: False-Friend layout
description: Highlights visualizations that look similar but require different interpretation

label: Binning
description: TODO: Check if there is a non-deceptive reason

label: Null or Infinite Values Not Visualized
description: Description missing.

label: Different scales across charts
description: Different scales used across charts.

label: Rainbow colormap
description: Justifies why the chart uses rainbow colormaps.

label: Redundant visual encoding
description: Multiple visual encodings are used redundantly.

label: Axis label stated in Context
description: Axis labels provided in context rather than directly on axis.

label: Data Source
description: Indicates data availability

label: Data Sources used
description: Indicates number of data sources used

label: Data Collection Methods
description: Description missing.

label: Data source(s) disclosed
description: Indicates that this visualization has one or more disclosed data sources

label: Multiple sources
description: Click to know more about our data.

label: Data source citation
description: Multiple data sources with citations

label: Missing Data
description: Percentage of missing data points

label: Original Data Availability
description: Availability of original data documents

label: Dynamic Data
description: Frequency of data updates, subject to changes.

label: Adjusted Baseline
description: Uses adjusted baseline such as per capita rates

label: Data Collection Method
description: The data has been collected using specific methods.

values.label: Derived
values.tooltip: Data generated or inferred from models.

label: Missing Data
description: Extent of missing data.

label: Data collection Method
description: Data collection method specified

label: % of the data showed
description: Percentage of the data shown

label: Rounding
description: The data has been rounded

label: Target Audience
description: Intended audience for the visualization

label: Aggregation Function
description: The function used to aggregate the data

label: Number of Data Sources
description: Number of different data sources used

label: Open data practice: 5/5
description: FIGMA TODO

label: Rounding
description: Data rounded to specified decimals

label: Aggregation
description: Data aggregation method visually

label: Aggregation Function
description: Function used for data aggregation

label: Content Warning
description: Visualization involves sensitive topics

label: Data Source Trust Level
description: Indicates the trust level of the data source.

label: Data Update Frequency
description: Frequency at which data is updated.

label: Percentage of Modeled Data
description: Percentage of data derived from computational models.

label: Level of Data Bias
description: Estimated level of bias present in the dataset.

label: Number of Aggregation Levels
description: Number of different aggregation levels applied in visualization.

label: Sampling Method
description: Method used for data sampling.
